intro: Urostigma hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Urostigma hirsutum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
